scripture: First of all, believe how much God loves you and whether you are considering a procedure or have just had a procedure, God's love will never change. It is not his will for you that you have a procedure and he wants to show you and your baby his support through your term and after. If you choose otherwise or have chosen otherwise, He still loves you but you will need to sincerely repent your decision and you will need to ultimately forgive yourself for making that decision as in the example of David's first child with Bathsheba where he needed to repent his sins and ultimately allow God to restore him (Psalms 51 & Psalms 32). At the end of the day, God's word says NOTHING can separate you from his LOVE. Internalize that fact as you are loved, needed and wanted. Choose life, Repent and come home to live for God. He will be there to support you.
quote: Jeremiah 1:5, Luke 12:7, Romans 8:37-39, Joshua 34:8, 2 Samuel 12:19-23/Joel 2:12-13/Acts 3:19/1 John 1:9
prayer: Thank you dear Lord as I now seek you. Please hear me and answer me. I need your grace and your forgiveness. I repent my actions and sincerely change my mind in such a way as to never return to such a grievous place or make such decisions as long as you are with me. Father, show me your plan for my life and let me know your will so I may follow you. In Jesus name - AMEN!

scripture: My friend, sexual immorality, excessive alcohol, chasing wealth, greed, and coveting are not things that are part of God's plan for your life as it is against God's will. A decision to abstain is for the health and benefit of your soul which are your thoughts, feelings and emotions that dictate your outward behaviors. Satan wants to influence them all for bad. Obey God's will and allow God to fill whatever emptiness that you think these things will satisfy. He is all that you will ever need and He will satisfy every desire. Trust the Lord and let him guide you on a righteous path that leads to joy and peace.
prayer: Father God, thank you for caring enough to love and guide me away from bad choices that most certainly will have bad outcomes. Rather, lead me to things that are godly, lasting and fulfilling so that I may come closer to you and be more like Jesus. In Jesus name - AMEN!

scripture: Whatever abuse you have experienced, Remember it is not your fault and you did not deserve it. Innocent and sinless Jesus experienced worse for you and he took it all so that you can leave your abuse on the cross with Him as He has already bore your pain and suffering. Please choose with full intentionality to bury your pain and let God overcome your hurt with his Love. God's love has the power you need to conquer your pain. Romans 12:19 also says that God will repay so there is no need for anger, malice, or revenge. Rather, offer forgiveness so that your heart can be righteous in the sight of God. You are already a  survivor and you will get through this with the help of the Lord.
prayer: Father, I thank you for taking my pain and hurt and abuse. You alone are the one who understands and knows how to restore me. Lord, keep me safe and renew my spirit and soul to be whole again and allow me to serve you with all that you have blessed me with. In Jesus name - AMEN!

scripture: STOP, STOP, STOP, you have more respect for yourself and your spouse. If you are involved in an adulterous relationship you are breaking God's law and whatever made you choose to be with another person is not worth grieving the Holy Spirit and potentially ruining your marriage. The Lord originally brought you two individuals together to become one in Him. God wants you to surrender to each other and be helpers for each other. Remember what brought you together initially and how your plans were 'forever' plans. They still can be. Look to God, as yes you can be reconciled to Him and your spouse. Don't be afraid to seek professional help and continue to pray in the affirmative that God will do for your marriage that which you cannot do on your own.
prayer: Father in heaven, I have broken your law and my commitment to my spouse. Forgive me and I pray this mistake is not fatal. Please help me to seek the forgiveness of my partner and friend that you joined together in matrimony. Fix us Lord, renew our faith in you and each other and fan the flames of our love to once again burn hot for each other as we trust you to be our third strand. In Jesus name - AMEN!

scripture: My friend, buried somewhere shallow or deep in your spirit is a hurt that has never been comforted or released and that is the source or origin of your anger, regardless of what triggered it. Be like God who is slow to anger and quick to give mercy. Jesus says to bring him your hurt, your fears, your brokenness and in return take love, peace and joy. Left unattended, anger will evolve and harden into bitterness which can possess your soul,impact and affect your outward behavior. If you have unfortunately done something against God or another, be sure to repent immediately and receive forgiveness. Do this with a sincere mindset of not returning to that behavior or environment and receive forgiveness. Listen and Believe in God, release your anger and let God make you complete on a daily basis. He is your creator with endless power and desire to get you back to better.
prayer: Father thank you for providing the remedy to all my problems. I am angry right now but I repent this bad fruit and its thinking and behaviors and ask you to change my heart to reflect new behaviors which demonstrate your love and grace. Guide my thoughts and actions moving forward and let them produce the good fruit that you have sown in me. In Jesus name - AMEN!

scripture: There is so much going on and all of it brings pressure from all sorts of directions. Hopes and expectations are supplanted by fear and doubt and you are left in the struggle. Pray to thank God in advance, Do what you can and rest. Know that God lives in you and he will satisfy your every need and he is never late and never lacking. Faith is your belief that God has the ability to help you in this time of need and trust is you taking action as if God has already met your need. God is your best friend and He will most certainly get through it.
prayer: Lord God, thank you for being my destination and resting place. In my humanity I can only do so much but in you anything is possible. Calm my spirit and bring peace to my soul. Father I trust you completely and believe that you will get me through and your glory will be revealed in the process. In Jesus name - AMEN!

scripture: Fair or unfair, someone wants to impose their judgement on you and make you feel less or you yourself cannot make peace with whatever you did. We all have sinned and come short of God's glory. As our creator, He knows we all came from dirt, yet, He provided a savior in Jesus, who took all our shame and buried it with his death on the cross. Remember, Paul persecuted Christians, David and Moses were murderers, Jacob was a liar and a cheat, and Abraham gave his wife to another man. I'm thinking you cannot top all of those. God forgave and restored them and he will do the same for you if you through your faith will let him. Walk tall knowing that God has your back and you only answer to Him.
prayer: Father thank you for I am safe in your presence. Lord, forgive my transgression against you and restore me to you. In doing so, please let me release any guilt and shame I have because Jesus' blood already covered it. Please anchor that knowledge in my spirit as the enemy wants to use it to distract, discourage, and deceive me. In Jesus name - AMEN!

scripture: I won't ask how you feel. I will just start by saying that the hurt, pain and  grief you are feeling is part of the human condition as God made us. He gave us close relationships for good reason, so understandably, the loss of a loved one comes with grief. I will also say that you will get through this with the help of Jesus. This is fact not conjecture. Losing a loved one is never easy but God is able to do abundantly more than you realize. With that knowledge, I encourage you to use all your emotions in a way that will glorify God. God is Love and love is an action word so put your love into action by giving someone the hug you would have given to your loved one. Make your smile reflect the smile they used to give you. Share your time to help others as you would have helped the one you lost. That is how you can honor them and keep their spirit alive. You will  likely still feel grief at the same time you express love but the expression of love will comfort your grief. God is sovereign and has spoken, therefore, trust in the Lord's wisdom and timing for calling them home and know that God is with you and He will never leave or forsake you. Joy will come quickly.
prayer: Thank you Father for the time I had and the experiences I shared with my loved one. I miss them dearly but I know your love will get me through. Please help me to bless others as I was blessed by the one I lost and may all who encounter me see that you are the reason I am able to keep smiling and moving forward. In Jesus name - AMEN!

scripture: I know it's literally all hate out there be it religion, race, politics,identity, social status or any number of things. It's not new as you should remember from the book of Acts how the first church was hated and treated. Many times in scripture, Jesus made the distinction that believers will not be friends with the world and that the world will persecute you just as they did Him. He told us this so that as it happens we are prepared rather than surprised or disappointed. We cannot serve two masters and therefore we are considered enemies by non-christians but we are known as God's friend as we walk in His way. You will make it by looking up to God and not across to the source of hate. Keep your focus on Jesus. Seek his approval because you will absolutely get it and it is only his approval that matters.
prayer: Thank you  Lord that I am in the world but not of this world. As the world shows me hate and unacceptance, help me to look to you and focus on doing kingdom business. Father, let me feel your comfort as I endure all that is before me and let me continue to be a light even though I am surrounded by darkness. I pray for those who oppose me and by default oppose you. Show them mercy Father that they may also come to know you. In Jesus name - AMEN!

scripture: Bitterness  is the fruit of unforgiveness and the root of anger. Trust me when I say that it runs deep and cold and is very difficult to rid if it lingers for long periods of time. Straight talk is that it is very much a process once you decide to release it. God forgave you and continues every time you sincerely ask no matter what you have done. Leave any and all revenge to the Lord because He is the only one who can render fair justice. You, my friend, must look for a way to love and pray for the person or event that has you bitter. Pray that God bless the one(s) who wronged you where they are serving him and that God corrects them where they have strayed away from his will. Then you will find favor in the Lord and your bitterness will fade away. No, you may never forget what happened but God's grace will cover you and that person or event will no longer cause you pain, suffering, or bitterness.
prayer: Thank you Father for solutions and understanding regarding those things that hurt the most. Your grace is sufficient to eliminate all the negative feelings associated with what happened to me and poisoned my heart. Help me to forgive, love and pray for all those involved and release me from any emotions that keep me connected to the awful things that happened. In Jesus name - AMEN!

scripture: God said with his own words that he will not condemn his people anymore after Jesus died for every mistake you will ever make. And God does not break his promises. So I need you to literally look at yourself in the mirror and tell the person that you see that God sees you also and he is ready to welcome you back and restore you and increase you. I need you to know that God does not think or process in human ways. His ways and thoughts are bigger and He can handle what happened and your part in it. You are not alone as everyone makes mistakes, maybe even big ones but God knows you are human and is always ready to forgive and when he does he will 'remember no more' so you should not either. Not one thing has ever gotten better by self loathing. Ask God to forgive you and then forgive yourself and walk tall knowing that you are the righteousness of God
prayer: Father, thank you. When Jesus died and rose again it was over and done with yet I struggle so hard with letting go of my mistakes especially the ones where I knew better. Help me Lord to accept what Jesus already did for me. Help me to seek your love and to forgive myself and to walk in your way. In Jesus name - AMEN!

scripture: Pick a word, any of these: suffering, sorrow, heartache, trouble, fear, and so on. You are feeling down, out, and lost because first of all, the gospels tell us that in this life, we will experience such things. Another possibility is that God is working in you and testing you so that he can finish his work in you. In short, this is God's way of showing his confidence in you. I will offer to you exactly what I tell myself in times of doubt or fear: I am called, therefore I am chosen. I am sanctified, therefore I am pure, I am justified, therefore I am made straight, I am righteous, therefore I am right, proper, and honorable. I am holy, therefore I am set apart and different. Trust me, you already have what you need. USE IT in the name of Jesus. Have faith, hope and trust in God. Be sure and confident in your expectations and in His due time he will show up on time.
prayer: Father, thank you. You are undefeated!! You have never lost, never been late, never been wrong, never forsaken us. Help us to remember and look forward confidently to how you work through us to get us through things. Then we will glorify you as we will be stronger and wiser through the experience. In Jesus name - AMEN!

scripture: I remember so clearly asking myself 'how did I get here?', 'I can't function, I am such a mess'... Whether this feeling is from a bad day or from a bad season, It is so important for you to know that you are not alone in your feelings. It is equally important to know that you matter to people and you matter to God. He wants you to feel his joy again and His peace again. No matter your feelings, you must focus on the facts. God loves you, God knows your pain, God wants to get you back to better. Tell God right now EVERYTHING on your mind and ask him to help fix it His way. Finally, keep talking to people who care for you and/or a professional Christian counselor if necessary and never stop praying and reading His word because God is ultimately the solution. See the examples of our biblical heroes and what they went through and how God kept His promises. He loves you the same and will keep His promises to you also. Thank him in advance every time you pray for helping you get back to better.
prayer: Lord you are so faithful, loving, and merciful. Thank you for your grace that gets me back to better. Hear me in my times of despair and depression and build a bridge for me back to you. I have faith that you will remain close to me as I endure, learn and grow through this tough season. In Jesus name - AMEN!

scripture: My friend, we gotta keep this at 100. And let's do it by the numbers… Fact: Doubt is disbelief that God can do what you are asking him to do. Fact: The cure for doubt is faith and trust. Fact: Faith is Hope with expectations and Trust is action based on that faith. Having said all this, your walk is only going to take you as far as your understanding. Your understanding comes from reading the word of God so that you can see what He has done in the lives of His people, so you can see what His promises are, so you may know how He will communicate with you. From here, you get to choose to have faith that God has the power to do what you need and trust him in such a way that you go and start doing what you are asking or wait with thanksgiving knowing that God will work your situation out according to His will and it will be the right outcome. That should give you peace and patience as you endure your situation.
prayer: Thank you father, you are so good all the time. You never miss but still sometimes I have fear and doubt. Lord, let me feel your presence and remind me who you are in my times of fear and doubt and do for me that which I cannot do for myself. In Jesus name - AMEN!

scripture: Congratulations, you are reading this because you acknowledge you likely feel guilt or shame or both because of some sinful act or actions. That's great because you are in the right place. I want to start here with a few definitions because in English this word has subtle differences that truly matter. The word 'REPENT' in Hebrew (Old Testament) literally means 'to turn around and return to God as in your behavior'. In Greek (New Testament), 'REPENT' means 'a change of mind that leads to a change in direction towards God.' This is the part that you are responsible for as you are convicted by your actions and want to forever move in a way that leads back to God. Then God says back to us in 1 John that if we repent our sins that he is faithful and just to forgive us. That said, if God has forgiven us then why in the world would you not forgive yourself. It's over!! You cannot have it back, God is bigger than whatever you did and you did not shock or surprise Him when it happened. No matter how bad it was, It is truly over. And assuming you repented from your heart, God will not remember your offense and neither should you. True repentance leaves no residue of regret. Therefore, you have every reason to accept God's forgiveness by forgiving yourself. Everyone falls short, accept it, bury it, and move on. God is waiting for you to return to Him in trust and obedience by changing your mind and heart and separating yourself from the sin(s) that captured you. C'mon and let's get back to His kingdom work with a clear conscience.
prayer: Father, thank you for taking my call. This is as hard as it gets because I can't get past the guilt and shame of what I did against you and my moral standards given to me by you. I have head knowledge of being forgiven, but now Lord please touch my heart, heal my soul and allow me to come back as I accept that Jesus already paid for my sins on the cross and therefore I am now forgiven, clean and righteous before you. In Jesus name - AMEN!

scripture: Ya let's admit that this is a hard one to do as you have clearly been deeply wounded by someone or something. I get it and still I have to tell you that God instructs you to forgive because forgiving is for YOU and not the offender. Frankly, scripture tells us that we are to forgive because we have been forgiven. It also instructs us to forgive fully, freely and repeatedly. While all this is true, It also makes sense to look through our human lens and point out some of the reasons that we do not forgive, things like: your deep hurt, there was no apology, it might be repeated, revenge, and perhaps even denial that you are hurt in the first place.  There are two main things to bear in mind. First, when you forgive others you relieve yourself of the bad fruits that would otherwise absolutely consume you like bitterness and anger among others. And second, God, in his word, says that when you forgive, you can still desire justice, but leave the justice and vengeance to Him because He alone knows how and when to disperse it. Finally, and super important God said and Jesus also said that when we forgive others, it allows God in heaven to forgive you. Please pray as these things require prayer that God gives you the strength to leave this burden at His feet and trust Him to restore you and also handle your offender.
prayer: Thank you Father for giving me a way out of this anger, frustration, fear, and bitterness. I have been somewhat consumed by this wrong done to me but I know that I need to release it to you. I surrender my burden to you, Lord. Please restore my joy and my peace. In Jesus name - AMEN!

quote: Like everything, It is important to start with the truth.Truth 1: Sex is fun and satisfying for a season. Truth 2: Sex outside of a marriage between a man and a woman is sin in the eyes of God. Huge conflict right but you are here because you agree with that but you are struggling with the morality aspect as it is so widely accepted and frankly it's widely expected these days. Yet, clearly you believe that God wants you to stop or never start. That is the wonderful, mature and correct choice. Let me encourage you to replace the  things that tempt you with a sexual outlet or release with things that you can do that garner God's approval as HE God watches your life choices. You must first guard your eyes, then guard your heart, followed by your mind and finally your behavior. That is the slippery slope of this sin if the enemy can discourage, deceive or distract you to let your guard down. The scriptures will guide you to the truth. Seriously, I am insisting that you get into the word. Then surround yourself with good friends who possess good values so you can  help each  other do good things. Avoid the shows, songs, periodicals and apps that tempt you otherwise and as with all things, pray and  ask for God's grace and mercy to  get you through weak moments. Enjoy a spiritual encounter with God rather than a carnal moment in the flesh.
scripture: Job 31:1/1 Corinthians 6:18-20/1 Corinthians 7:2,8-9/1 Corinthians 10:13/1 Thessalonians 4:3-8/1 John 2:16
prayer: Father in Heaven, thank you for being my source of strength. My flesh is weak but you are stronger. Help me to turn to you as the world challenges my faith and commitment to your commands. I trust you Lord. Be my strength and guide my way. In Jesus name - AMEN!

quote: Believer... This is among Satan's favorite and most effective tools to keep your thoughts and behavior away from kingdom business. Guilt cuts you deep and engenders other feelings like doubt, self-pity and fear among other things. Know this ABSOLUTELY - God does not send guilt - EVER. It is a product of the enemy alone. 1 Peter 5 says that Satan is always looking for someone to devour and 1 Peter 2 says that your sinful desires literally wage war against your soul. Romans 3 says that we all sin and fall short.  So God already knows we are periodically going to fall victim to the flesh and the influence of the enemy. That's why he  sent a savior and a path back through to Him through repentance and faith. Hear me clearly  on this... TRUE REPENTANCE DOES NOT LEAVE A RESIDUE OF GUILT OR REGRET. And not to accept this truth is to waste the life and death of Jesus Christ. Release of guilt is the embodiment of grace itself. This is a fact, not a feeling. Repent your transgression, be forgiven, move on without guilt and serve the Lord with boldness. Do this anytime you fall and without hesitation so guilt cannot take root.
scripture: Psalms 32:5/Isaiah 45:3/Romans 8:1/Hebrews 9:14, 10:22
prayer: Lord God thank you for redemption. In spite of what we do you still love us, forgive us, and restore us with freedom from guilt and a clean conscience. Help us Father to accept  this special love that can only come from you. In Jesus name - AMEN!

quote: A cultural response would be tough given that such behavior is accepted and usually celebrated these days. I can't tell you how many times I see someone on TV confess their homosexuality to a huge round of applause. Well, I am sorry to tell you that no one in heaven is clapping. Not one creature or angel and certainly not God our creator or our savior Jesus Christ. Fortunately, scripture is not cultural nor is scripture bound by time. If you are struggling and in need of encouragement, I think it is a good thing in that you have not given in to acceptance that homosexual behavior is normal in the eyes of God. Congratulations on that. My message and encouragement is really one of understanding that you are suffering and you want to get back to better. God calls you to be obedient in a non-emotional way. He asks you to trust in his word, which is why He gave it to you and not to trust in how you feel. The opposite of homosexual behavior is not heterosexual behavior. The opposite of homosexual behavior is morality. Same sex relations, pre-marital relations, any sexual relations outside of marriage according to scripture is sexual immorality and therefore sin in The eyes of the Lord. Scripture says that God's kindness is intended to lead you to repentance. You are a Christian and therefore righteous and therefore you live by faith. So, my friend, I ask you to put your faith into practice. Having faith means you believe that God has the power to deliver any need. Having trust in God means that you will act on that faith. Though not easy, your faith and trust can and will give you everything necessary. Pray endlessly and earnestly because in this case prayer is your oxygen. It will be your lifeforce and as an ambassador of Christ, I guarantee that God will not forsake you in your time of need.
scripture: Psalms 34:4/Romans 1:16-17/Romans 3:21-26/Romans 8:37-39 /1 Corinthians 6:9-11/2 Corinthians 5:17/1 Thessalonians 4:3-8/1 Thessalonians 5:17/Hebrews 13:8 /1 Peter 1:14-16
prayer: Father thank you for your compassion and understanding and longsuffering with us. Thank you also for your word which is our handbook on how to live, thrive and survive this world. As we struggle in our humanity, comfort us and show us your way. Hear our call and deliver us as only you can from everything that binds us and keeps us from your purpose. In Jesus name - AMEN!

quote: Whether your insecurity comes from your skills, appearance, possessions or some combination of them all; I need you to KNOW that you are the righteousness of God and that makes you complete, necessary, and relevant in God's eyes. That said, you still live and interact with people who want to make you feel less than. Honestly, you will never be able to control other people so I need you to focus on what you can control. God says you are part of his body, God says you are his treasure, God says his grace is sufficient to get you through absolutely anything but you need to believe it, have faith in it and exercise trust in it. Your insecurity is directly and only from the enemy whose tactics are discouragement, distraction and deception. God will not just replace or erase your insecurities, rather you must choose to fight back and to stand in God's truth and take a step in confidence as you trust in God's truth. Please do that right now. Say it out loud that Satan is a liar. Say that you believe God wants the best for you and is ready to give it to you. Finally, Scripture says exactly, 'Let us then approach God's throne of grace with confidence, so that we may receive mercy and find grace to help us in our time of need.' Be confident in the Lord, he will get you back to better.
scripture: 2 Corinthians 5:21/Isaiah 61:10/John 8:44/Romans 5:17-18/Ephesians 6:14/Romans 8:28-39
prayer: Father, thank you for tearing the curtain so long ago that I have direct access to you now in my time of need. I am struggling to believe in myself and the things that keep me grounded in you. Help me believe in you and in myself as you live in me. Let me feel your presence, Lord and open my eyes to see your works and wonders in my life. In Jesus name - AMEN!

quote: Understand first of all that your kids love their parents and parents love their kids even though you are having a tough time right now. I encourage you to remind yourself of your role as the parent and if you are a kid please be mindful of your role according to God's word. The first responsibility in either case is to lead with love in all things. Love is kind, gentle, and good so be those things to your child or parent. Be those things first. Next, God says to always leave room for forgiveness. You may be right in every respect but is being right worth your closeness with someone you love so deeply. Find a way to understand, accept, and perhaps even try it from the perspective of each other; meaning mom or dad take a look through your child's lens and remember their challenges and temptations and kids please consider your parents job as it is to protect, guide and provide for you. It is not to be a genie and give you everything you want or to be your best friend.  You might find that the other side is not so bad or you might at least find that there is room for compromise. All that said, there is a biblical hierarchy for parents and kids and nothing I am saying is in contradiction to this principle. If you are a parent, then you need to show leadership. If you are a child, then you need to respect your parents even if you disagree. Jesus is the great mediator here and whatever the issue, it is addressed in His word and His wisdom. Both of you should look up towards God, come close to him and I promise you will see that your problem is smaller than you think or better said, God is bigger than your problem. Resolve things God's way and you both will be better off in the long run.
scripture: Matthew 7:9-11/Ephesians 6:1-4/Hebrews 12:5-11/Ephesians 4:25-27,32/Psalms 133:1/Colossians 3:20-21/James 1:19-20
prayer: Thank you Lord for your clear instruction and guidance regarding kids and parents. Help us to trust in you as we discover through your word how to support, trust, listen, and work together within your precepts and the family structure. Father, remove any lingering negative feelings and let love guide us closer to one another. In Jesus name - AMEN!

quote: In Hebrews, the writer explains that even Jesus himself in the form of man had to learn obedience as a condition of earning the right to be savior in God's eyes. Clearly He did not fail. There is no substitute for obedience and there are many ways you need to understand exactly what obedience is in God's eyes. You also need to understand the opposite of obedience as there is no middle ground in this case. Follow my thinking here as I try to paint a picture in your mind. The case is  OBEDIENCE v DISOBEDIENCE which can be characterized in many ways to include... Belief v Unbelief / God's way v Your Preference / Submission v Refusal / Hard Way v Easy Way / Acceptance v Rebellion / Confirmation v Conviction / Free v Costly and the BIG ONE… Life v Death. Every choice you make will land you on one side or the other and each choice has consequences at God's discretion and timing. Those are the facts. Yet, my friend, my strong encouragement is to be obedient to God's laws first of all which are laid out all throughout scripture. There are no surprises there and know that they exist not to keep you from fun or getting what you want, they exist to keep you from choices and consequences that will never let you obtain fun or what you really want. Then trust in God's will which in very simple terms is to do the next thing he tells you to do. If you will just focus on one decision at a time, seek God's counsel and desire through prayer and knowledge of His word, then nothing but good consequences will come from your good choices. Yes, you will have to sacrifice your preferences at times and yes you, like the rest of us will have challenges, but God knows the outcome and in the end He will only lead you to a great outcome.
scripture: Deuteronomy 30:15-16/Proverbs 3:5/Luke 6:46-49/John 14:23-24/Romans 6:16/James 1:21-25/Hebrews 5:8-9
prayer: Father it is your way period as you are our sovereign Lord. That's it and That's all. Thank you for being so clear and straightforward. Help me to mature as a believer so that I can obey your call on my life. I know you will never forsake me. In Jesus name - AMEN!

quote: Wow... How hard is it to not hear from God when you have an expectation, emergency, desire or need. I have been there just as many other believers have experienced the same. The challenge is to remember that God is not only sovereign but he is consistent. First off, God is not picking on you or playing with you. He knows your future and has plans for it. Yet, His thinking is not our thinking and His timing is not usually our timing and we have no right or basis to put expectations on our creator. Rather, when God is silent, we must stand on his promises. We must know his word for your situation. Then, talk to Him, tell Him exactly the details of your issues and tell Him that you trust Him more than you trust yourself. Do this with the knowledge that if things are done in your timing you will get your results. If things are done in God's timing you will get God's results. Also, do this with the knowledge that His word says He will do 'abundantly and exceedingly more.' His word says, 'nothing in creation will ever separate you from his Love.' His word says, 'He will never leave you nor forsake you.' From here, my friend, you have to do your job and wait on the Lord with great expectations, because in the fullness of time, God will do mighty things as He accomplishes His purpose through you.
scripture: Psalms 27:13-14, 37:25, 94:14/Joshua 1:5/Isaiah 40:31/Micah 7:7/Romans 8:28/Romans 8:35-39/Ephesians 3:20/2 Peter 1:4
prayer: Thank you Father for always being near. Waiting is so difficult but you know best and I desire your outcome not mine. Help me to remember your promises regarding your people as I know you will do above and beyond what I need. Thank you in advance for your blessing. In Jesus name - AMEN!

quote: I bet if we pull back the curtain and have an honest moment, it feels good right? After all, sin is great amusement but I am also guessing that you may be in over your head and you want to stop sinning so willfully or regularly. OK, the fact is that you were born with a sin virus and you will always be drawn to sin if done without repentance and without the renewing of your mind to accomplish God's will, not pleasing your own. It is really as simple as it sounds in concept but it can be difficult in application. If you are still with me, then now we can really get going because your place of failure in sin is your place of recovery upon repentance. I suggest you consider making some hard changes in your environment or your relationships or your habits so that you make room for God. You might need some help along the way so don't be afraid of groups, accountability partners, counseling and church to replace the time you currently spend doing things not of God. Finally, please trust me on this. You need a daily habit of prayer and scripture. Start small but be consistent. God will meet you, I promise. And He will give you everything you need to get past the sinful stage and onto a consistently great walk with Him.
scripture: Psalms 32:5/1 John 1:9/2 Corinthians 7:9-10/Galatians 5:16-17/Ephesians 2:3-7/Hebrews 4:14-16/James 4:7-10
prayer: Father, I am a bit of a mess right now but praise your name that you have not abandoned me in my sin. I want to change, Lord, permanently change and serve you. I repent my past behavior and ask you to renew and restore me to a place of righteousness. Thank you for your tender mercies and loving kindness. In Jesus name - AMEN!

quote: Suffering is associated with joy, necessity, inevitability, strength, even death depending on where you look in scripture. It is important to know this and it is important to know that I get how bad it feels to suffer. Yet, EVERY Christian MUST suffer if we are going to follow Jesus and of course, Jesus is our model who sacrificed Himself and suffered 16 different ways to the point of death for you and me. However, God wants you to have peace and joy in your suffering because you know the end of the story. God will give you victory whether in this life or the next so nothing else matters. And while in this life, Christ Himself said to be of good cheer for He has overcome the world. So now we gotta find your peace and joy. Pray that God touches you and your situation in a real way as only He can. Ask Him how you can use your suffering to do kingdom work just as the Apostle Paul did in his work? Ask how you can help someone else in spite of your pain? Ask how your testimony about your suffering can bless someone else in a similar situation? I hope you are getting this tactic as I am encouraging you to do a hard pivot from your situation to things God can use regardless of your status. If you shift your focus from victim to victory and service of others in the name of the Lord, I know God will give you all that you need to endure your own circumstances.
scripture: 2 Corinthians 4:17-18/John 14:27/John 16:33/Romans 5:3-5/Romans 8:18/Philippians 1:29/James 1:2-4/1 Peter 1:6-8
prayer: Father in heaven, thank you for your comfort in tough times and the knowledge that no matter my suffering, we will win in the end. Show me where and how I can use my suffering to help someone grow closer to you including myself. Father, I trust you and I receive the peace of Jesus as we overcome together. In Jesus name - AMEN!

quote: If you are having a bad day or two, keep reading. If you are having a bad season, scroll up and click the depression tag. I am writing this as an inmate in prison so clearly I can relate to having a bad day, yet, I don't stay there, I won't stay there and that needs to be your first choice. You need to decide that you will not have sad days. Absolutely, things happen out of your control, someone may hurt you or you may get some bad news; perhaps people purposely or randomly frustrate you; perhaps your circumstances and outcomes simply just don't meet your expectations. God says to expect this first of all, as it is literally part of the human condition. But now you have to listen to what else he says; he says to seek peace in your spirit and pursue it because his ears are attentive to the prayers of the righteous. Then he wants you to remember that Jesus was sad as the world rejected him but you can arm yourself with his same attitude that God can and will overcome all if you exercise faith and trust so that finally, God can finish his good work in you. God has a plan to prosper you but it does mean at times you will go through 'sad' on your way to getting to your harvest. I need you to seriously please hear me on this because God cannot do for you unless you come to agreement with Him that this is the new direction you want to take your thinking and behavior. I need you to make a choice in faith that you will pursue peace, joy, happiness and purpose. Choose these things and remember all that Christ did just so that you have the freedom to make these choices.
scripture: Jeremiah 29:11/Psalms 30:5/Psalms 34:4-7/Psalms 91:1-2/John 16:33/Philippians 1:6/1 Peter 3:12/James 1:3-4
prayer: Father, thank you that in my sadness I can find comfort, peace, and joy in you. You are my shelter. Help me to remember all that Jesus did so that I do not need to remain sad and let me feel your presence as I now focus on you and your promises. In Jesus name - AMEN!

quote: There are many ways one can steal. There is the obvious where you take something intentionally that does not belong to you. If that is your issue I simply say stop it and remind you that you are part of the body of Christ which means that your work should be useful to help others not take from them. Other ways you may struggle is by being late and therefore not being respectful of others' time. Perhaps, you are not committed to paying your tithes or you are in a position to overcharge people to gain an unfair profit. And please let us not forget that you might have stolen on an emotional level by involving yourself in gossip or slander which steals the otherwise good reputation from another person. No matter what the motivation or intention, it has to stop. I am so glad that you are reading this because it means that you agree and that means that God can forgive you as you confess this to Him and He can strengthen you so that you do not continue with such behavior any longer. You see, we are a community of believers who ultimately will have to give an account and be rewarded for our actions so why not have them be as good as they can be. Look for ways to do for others. Do not be resentful if someone has more and do not look to yourself to satisfy your needs because God is your ultimate provider. He is your never late, fully committed, omnipotent, omniscient, and omnipresent provider. He will do for you exceedingly and abundantly more than you can do for yourself so why not let Him
scripture: Ephesians 4:28/Malachi 3:8/1 John 1:9/2 Corinthians 5:10/Colossians 3:23-24/James 5:4/Romans 13:7/Philippians 4:19
prayer: Lord God I thank you so much for giving me good thoughts to replace the ones that can hurt others by stealing from them. Help me to apply and internalize your word by thinking of the needs of others first while trusting and believing that you will take care of me. In Jesus name - AMEN!    Dear Lord ... (placeholder).

quote: Yes, it's back...AGAIN!! The temptation to do something you know to be wrong according to God. It's the thing that God clearly states in His word that you will not get beyond His capacity to provide relief, assistance and a permanent cure. AAAAHHHHH!!!! I know, it is so darn frustrating. As much as it bugs you, don't be concerned in that way because scripture also says that the enemy will always tempt you and though it can happen anytime, he really likes to hit you with temptation when you are weak or after a nice victory. Literally expect it rather than be shocked by it; thinking you are beyond such things. You have to be on guard and sensitive to those things that tempt you so that you can see them coming and then you must fight back so that they don't overtake you. You will not win long term by simply trying to resist. The enemy's tactics are too good and he is too strong to defeat independently. You must use what God gave you with the same tactics that Jesus used when being tempted by Satan. First prayer and acknowledgement to God that the temptation is real and you do not want to give into it. Then follow up with scripture that counters the temptation. If it is a repeated temptation, you may want to memorize the scripture to be even more prepared. Next, as funny as it sounds, RUN!!! Hurry away from that environment or person who would have you sin. Put distance and keep distance between you and “it” and finally, I strongly suggest that you invite accountability. Alone, the enemy has a huge advantage; but with the help from your fellow believers you are so much stronger. Your spouse, pastor, study leader, friend, professional counselor are among those willing and wanting to support you when you are in need. Allow God to flow help to you through them as you combat the things that tempt you to sin.
scripture: Psalms 119:105,133/Ecclesiastes 4:9-10/Matthew 4:1-11/Matthew 6:13/Matthew 26:41/1 Corinthians 10:13/Galatians 6:1-2/Ephesians 6:13-18/2 Timothy 2:22/1 Peter 5:8
prayer: Father I thank you for your word and for your people. Help me to use them both and hear my prayers as I try to overcome this temptation. I know Father that you are bigger than any challenge and that you will see me through this battle. Give me your strength, wisdom and protection. In Jesus name - AMEN!

scripture: At first they feel pretty good, at first they help. All in ways you have most likely never experienced. There are too many different reasons as to why you started but you are reading this because you do not want to continue. You are over the amusement and elation of the high and you are tired of rationalizing the using, the apologizing and the behaviors not to mention the shame and stigma of the low times in a sober moment. Trust me, I get it. Jesus says to give him your anxieties because He cares for you. He wants you to come to Him so that He can provide rest for your soul. That's your mental anguish, that is where the fight is. Now this won't necessarily be easy but who knows, it might; however, the point is that with things like abuse of drugs and alcohol it is important to replace what you give up, because if you are empty, the enemy will attack with full force to fill that empty even bigger than it was. This challenge is beyond a will-power thing. You gotta share this with someone rooted in the faith. Or join a professional faith based group, or both. That takes strength, resolve and courage but I promise that God will meet you if you will make the effort and He will replace the temporary and amusing result of using drugs and alcohol with a lasting pleasure far better than you could hope for. God is knocking, invite Him in to heal your brokenness. Make this choice just like the day you got saved and receive your deliverance just like you received your Salvation. I am listing a few more scriptures than normal below to help you in your time of need and encouragement. Memorize the most useful one(s) and be in agreement with God and get better. However, if you feel things are out of your control at this moment, Click to go to the HOTLINE tab directly and connect with people that are ready to assist you and provide you the support you are asking for.
prayer: Thank you Lord for still taking my call. I don't know how I got here but I feel dependent on things other than you to get me through. My best intentions and will power are not enough. As I take this step to stop using, please replace that void with all things Jesus and heal me. Also Lord, please help me find an accountability partner or program that I can join where I can get continued support to win this fight and serve you. In Jesus name - AMEN!

scripture: It happens quick doesn't it? and most times you don't see it coming. Yet something drew you to click this tab which means that you may see another episode that could lead to commit violence and you want to avoid the possibility of things going there. I'm really glad you chose to consider this alternative. In that violence comes in many forms with emotional and physical leading the way, it is important to be spiritually prepared. It is important to recognize your triggers and it is important to not fight this battle alone. First off, seek professional help if you are committing violence towards others like your spouse or significant other or your kids. This is not something that can wait if you have been hurting others. Now, let's think for a minute and consider why… There is an old saying that “hurt people - hurt people” meaning that you are probably expressing bad outward behavior because there is unresolved conflict working in you beyond what you can process and control. The good news is that our God can help and handle and provide relief if you will surrender your pain, fears, and past experiences that have you in your current condition and state of mind. God is faithful and wants you to be free to love others as He loves you. He wants you to pray and praise rather than harass and hit. I encourage you to release your feelings and emotions to God while you also work with trusted and qualified faith-based resources to get you to a better place where you can allow God to restore you to health and where you can then work to restore what you did to others. Click this prayer request tab and list everything so that we may join you in prayer.
prayer: Thank you Father in advance for helping me get better and beyond my condition. I acknowledge that I can get out of control and I need you to release me from my violent outbreaks. Give me your peace Lord that does not come from the world. Allow me to trust that you will work things out in my best interest so that will also accomplish your purpose. In Jesus name - AMEN!

scripture: Looks like you decided to fall on your sword here and admit that you have not been honest with the things you are saying about yourself, your experiences, and/or other people and it is causing you some trouble either internally or externally or both. Ya, lies can appear to be so simple and so harmless but they are also so far reaching and hurtful. The bible tells us always to be truthful and it even defines Jesus himself as the truth so that we have something to measure against. We are human and it can be hard sometimes to be truthful because truth does have consequences and it may cost you some relationships and some opportunities. But lies also have consequences which usually cost more in the long run outwardly and inwardly and they just erode your spirit and your soul. There is no lie worth all that. The enemy uses lies to convince you that your lies are not so bad but trust me, they are, and once your reputation is corrupted, it can be really difficult to regain it. All this said, let's take the high road which is God's road. It is the one that leads to all things good here on earth and it's ultimately the same road that leads to heaven when all things are said and done. Without the lies comes the peace, joy, and happiness you really were after in the first place which, by the way, will literally last you from here to eternity.
prayer: Dear Lord ... (placeholder).
